description:
Sunoco LP is a leading energy infrastructure and fuel distribution master limited partnership operating across 47 U.S. states, Puerto Rico, Europe, and Mexico. The Partnership's midstream operations include an extensive network of approximately 9,500 miles of pipeline and over 100 terminals. This critical infrastructure complements the Partnership's fuel distribution operations, which serve approximately 10,000 convenience stores, independent dealers, commercial customers, and distributors.

At Sunoco, we take great pride in what we do and wholeheartedly believe our employees drive success for our company and our customers. We are always looking for the best and brightest talent and we are committed to making your job a challenging and rewarding experience.

Summary

The Unbranded Analytics team is part of the Unbranded Sales organization and is responsible for providing the data and analysis needed to support the Sales team and drive continued growth. The position requires an individual with technical proficiency, strong communication skills, and a desire to learn the Unbranded FOB Sales business.

The role reports to the Manager of Unbranded Analytics. This role is an excellent opportunity to learn the aspects of the Unbranded Sales process and develop in a fast-paced environment.

Responsibilities

The analyst will support existing analytical tools and dashboards and develop new solutions that provide insights into existing business processes (e.g., hedge exposure management, sales forecasting, etc.) and support new business growth. This position requires effective use of Sunoco’s core technology programs including: Right Angle, DTN TABs, Excel, scripting languages (i.e., R & Python), and SQL / relational database management system (RBDMS) infrastructure.

The role will work with various internal groups including:

Sales Reps to support all functions of the sales process.
Supply & Trading to understand cost structure and market dynamics.
Other internal analytics groups to align processes.
Others may include Midstream, Supply Optimization, etc.

Other responsibilities include:

Provide backup support & coverage for other Unbranded Analytics Analysts when they are out of the office.
Ad Hoc requests as determined by the Manager Unbranded Sales Analytics.


Position Requirements:

Required Skills:

Strong technical skills in statistics
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Proficiency in one or more scripting languages (e.g. R, Python, Sas)
Proficiency in SQL, including building and debugging queries
Strong Data Mining skills including Data Cleaning, Data Preparation and Data Visualization
A strong eagerness and willingness to learn and develop technically in the field of data science

Preferred Skills:

Familiarity with Frameworks for code-based business intelligence tools such as R-Shiny, Dash etc.
Familiarity with API Data requests
Familiarity with Power BI, Tableau, Qlik etc.
Experience building and debugging Excel Macros
Knowledge of the Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) including Boards, Source Control (Git) and collaboration
Experience with ETL/ELT and Data Warehousing

Formal Education & Certification

Bachelor’s degree
Knowledge & Experience
Microsoft Office Suite skills required (Word, Excel, PowerPoint & Outlook)
Familiarity with scripting languages and SQL required
Good presentation and formal proposal skills
Qualifications & Characteristics
Self-starter; self-motivated; sense of urgency; personable; extroverted personality; well organized; ability to achieve goals; ability to focus and pay attention to detail
Ability to multi-task, analytical and problem-solving skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Passionate & strong desire to win

Required experience is commensurate with the selected job level:

The Associate Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree and 0-2 years of relevant job related experience
The Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree and 2-5 years of relevant job related experience
The Senior Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree and 5-8 years of relevant job related experience
The Lead Specialist/Analyst level requires a Bachelor’s degree and 8+ years of relevant job related experience
Work Environment
High energy and fun
High level of accountability
Absolutely goal and results driven
Management team that truly works to see their team members achieve success
Demonstrated and consistent track record of growth
Financially stable, highly successful, growing
